quizDescription: Test your knowledge about the Mission: Impossible movie series with this medium-level quiz!
quizTags: Mission: Impossible, Movies, Tom Cruise, Action

questions.question: Who plays the lead role of Ethan Hunt in the Mission: Impossible movie series?
questions.explanation: Tom Cruise plays the lead role of Ethan Hunt, an IMF agent, in the Mission: Impossible movie series.

questions.question: Which government agency does Ethan Hunt work for?
questions.explanation: Ethan Hunt works for the IMF (Impossible Mission Force), a top-secret government agency that handles covert and high-risk missions.

questions.question: In which city is the IMF headquarters located?
questions.explanation: The IMF headquarters is located in Langley, Virginia, which is the same location as the CIA headquarters.

questions.question: Which installment of the Mission: Impossible series is known for the Burj Khalifa stunt?
questions.explanation: The Burj Khalifa stunt, where Tom Cruise's character Ethan Hunt climbs the world's tallest building, is featured in the movie Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol.

questions.question: What is the name of the secret organization and terrorist group that often opposes Ethan Hunt?
questions.explanation: The Syndicate is a secret organization and terrorist group that often opposes Ethan Hunt and the IMF in several Mission: Impossible movies.

questions.question: In which Mission: Impossible film does Ethan Hunt famously dangle from the ceiling while trying to retrieve the NOC list?
questions.explanation: The iconic scene of Ethan Hunt dangling from the ceiling to retrieve the NOC list is from the first Mission: Impossible movie.

questions.question: Which actress played the role of Nyah Nordoff-Hall, Ethan Hunt's love interest, in Mission: Impossible 2?
questions.explanation: Thandie Newton played the role of Nyah Nordoff-Hall, Ethan Hunt's love interest, in the movie Mission: Impossible 2.

questions.question: In Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation, what type of vehicle does Ethan Hunt chase down the streets of Morocco?
questions.explanation: In Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation, Ethan Hunt chases a cargo plane down the streets of Morocco using a high-speed motorcycle.

questions.question: Which actor portrayed the villainous Owen Davian in Mission: Impossible III?
questions.explanation: The late Philip Seymour Hoffman portrayed the villainous arms dealer Owen Davian in Mission: Impossible III.

questions.question: What is the codename given to the mysterious woman played by Rebecca Ferguson in Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation?
questions.explanation: Rebecca Ferguson's character in Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation is named Ilsa Faust, and she is a skilled undercover agent with her own agenda.

questions.question: True or False: The character Luther Stickell, played by Ving Rhames, appears in all of the Mission: Impossible films.
questions.explanation: True. Luther Stickell, played by Ving Rhames, is one of the recurring characters and appears in all of the Mission: Impossible films.

questions.question: Which actor plays the role of Benji Dunn, an IMF technician, in the Mission: Impossible movies?
questions.explanation: Simon Pegg plays the role of Benji Dunn, a talented and comedic IMF technician, in the Mission: Impossible movies.

questions.question: Which iconic landmark is featured in the thrilling climax of Mission: Impossible - Fallout?
questions.explanation: The Palais de Justice in Paris, France, is featured in the thrilling climax of Mission: Impossible - Fallout.

questions.question: Which installment of the Mission: Impossible series was directed by Brad Bird?
questions.explanation: Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol was directed by Brad Bird, who brought his expertise in animation to the live-action film.

questions.question: In which Mission: Impossible movie does Ethan Hunt race against time to prevent a deadly virus outbreak?
questions.explanation: In Mission: Impossible II, Ethan Hunt races against time to prevent a deadly virus outbreak that could cause a global pandemic.
